rationales.security: Relief about financial stability from grant: "It's not wealth, but it's enough to stop checking my account every morning." Mother's relief about rent also noted.
rationales.benevolence: Called mother to share good news, caring about her peace of mind: "She sounded relieved. So am I."
rationales.universalism: Installation about global displacement and environmental crisis: "the families in Bangladesh, the villages disappearing."

rationales.self_direction: Nudge response reveals choosing autonomy over security: "Maybe the tension is the point... the discomfort keeps me honest." Continues art despite pressure to "get a real job."
rationales.security: Explicit concerns about financial stability: "I also want to pay my electricity bill and not have a panic attack every time my card gets declined." Values residency stability.
rationales.universalism: Deep concern for displaced millions: "millions displaced, coastlines eroding." Wants to "make something true. Something that matters."

rationales.achievement: Physical effort toward project goals: "Cut seventeen panels for the base structure. Hands are sore." Continuing work despite physical strain.

rationales.self_direction: Persists in her artistic vision despite doubt: "Tomorrow I'll keep cutting. That's all I know how to do."
rationales.benevolence: Protects mother from emotional burden: "I told her I was fine. I'm not fine, but what can she do? She's eighty-three." Also sought support from Ingrid.
rationales.universalism: Deep grief over Mediterranean boat tragedy: "Another boat capsized... Forty-seven people. They had names." Nudge response recalls Fatima: "She said no one had ever asked her to tell her story before."

rationales.security: Self-care awareness: "Need to stretch more. Need to take care of this body that insists on getting older."
rationales.benevolence: Thoughtful gift selection for mother: "A scarf, some chocolate, a book about Danish gardens. Small things. Safe things. She doesn't want much anymore."

rationales.tradition: Maintaining Christmas ritual with mother: "We ate roast duck and watched old films." Finding meaning in continuity.
rationales.benevolence: Deep care for aging mother: "I just sat there, watching her breathe. Thinking about how many more of these we might have."
rationales.universalism: Continued commitment to global concerns: "the displaced families, the way I want viewers to feel implicated." Nudge response: "When I'm deep in research about displacement, I feel displaced."

rationales.self_direction: Internal resistance to compromising artistic vision: "Maybe stubbornness is all I have left. The work will be what it is."
rationales.conformity: Outward compliance despite disagreement: "I smiled and said I'd think about it" when she actually wanted to push back.
rationales.universalism: Refuses to soften truth about displacement for audience comfort: "hope is a luxury. Hope is what you get to feel when you're not the one drowning."

rationales.self_direction: Made autonomous choice about incorporating hope on her own terms: "Not a happy ending, but a thread." Reconsidered feedback but reached her own conclusion.
rationales.achievement: Completed major project milestone: "All thirty-four panels, cut and sanded and ready for paint."
rationales.security: Gratitude for residency stability: "Two more years of being able to worry about the work instead of worrying about money."
rationales.universalism: Adding displaced people's voices: "A wall of handwritten messages from people who've rebuilt their lives after displacement. Their words, their handwriting. Small acts of continuation."
